## 

<span key="93882dfce1644fe2b5ea350a713e052b"><span offset-key="93882dfce1644fe2b5ea350a713e052b:0">The Complete JavaScript Reference Guide</span></span>

<span key="2fda8796582146809aa6b79f63e5cb15"><span offset-key="2fda8796582146809aa6b79f63e5cb15:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="a52fddf2b3364c8eaaecb1b40d939d2e"></span>

<span key="2195d763b4ee4b9a93acb7144a079e2c"><span offset-key="2195d763b4ee4b9a93acb7144a079e2c:0">### How to learn effectively</span></span>

<span key="61c98814e806480799a67250ec9a1800">**Learning**<span offset-key="61c98814e806480799a67250ec9a1800:1">: The acquisition of skills and the ability to apply them in the future.</span></span>

<span key="39c78f42ddb143d98a23f97fae745c93">**What makes an Effective learner?**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="5d1d8ad290ba49f6bff4d23c614fe8ce"><span offset-key="5d1d8ad290ba49f6bff4d23c614fe8ce:0">They are active listeners.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="beb6a40f316b47eda99dd0fdbe18e1dc"><span offset-key="beb6a40f316b47eda99dd0fdbe18e1dc:0">They are engaged with the material.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="d7625c099680455bb3675556a441eebd"><span offset-key="d7625c099680455bb3675556a441eebd:0">They are receptive of feedback.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="a3da4b88eb3449b181f5e193c454e82e"><span offset-key="a3da4b88eb3449b181f5e193c454e82e:0">They are open to difficulty.</span></span>

<span key="90f72e572a08456a837bb43c894ed7f5">**Why do active learning techniques feel difficult?**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="c58081c63f4543c8936c18d5da4b9abc"><span offset-key="c58081c63f4543c8936c18d5da4b9abc:0">It feels difficult because you are constantly receiving feedback, and so you are constantly adapting and perfecting the material.</span></span>

<span key="35890ea72f9b42e68b5d06d15ae58a0c">**Desirable Difficulty**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="e3a47bad6bd0443cafe157f324f7a7f8"><span offset-key="e3a47bad6bd0443cafe157f324f7a7f8:0">The skills we wish to obtain is often a difficult one.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="288647f76deb470681059edaeaf37782"><span offset-key="288647f76deb470681059edaeaf37782:0">We want challenging but possible lessons based on current level of skill.</span></span>

<span key="1b5b8e12538440d1b576a902f30dcfdb">**Effective learners space their practice**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="191070915465444bb6ef23df4a51d13d"><span offset-key="191070915465444bb6ef23df4a51d13d:0">Consistent effort > cramming => for </span>**durable knowledge**</span>

<span key="819dcc496c584933946b47ba7898a01b"><span offset-key="819dcc496c584933946b47ba7898a01b:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

## 

<span key="14009777e91b4d9084eb8268ab963ee5"><span offset-key="14009777e91b4d9084eb8268ab963ee5:0">Getting visual feedback in your programs</span></span>

<span key="7692dc4354f842f5bd4e2e5e394468fb"><span offset-key="7692dc4354f842f5bd4e2e5e394468fb:0">The first command we’ll learn in JavaScript is </span>`console.log`<span offset-key="7692dc4354f842f5bd4e2e5e394468fb:2">. This command is used to </span>*print*<span offset-key="7692dc4354f842f5bd4e2e5e394468fb:4"> something onto the screen. As we write our first lines of code, we’ll be using </span>`console.log`<span offset-key="7692dc4354f842f5bd4e2e5e394468fb:6"> frequently as a way to visually see the output of our programs. Let’s write our first program:</span></span>

1

<span key="b12aa1e10cf74cc6aa600c831c2d1acb"><span offset-key="b12aa1e10cf74cc6aa600c831c2d1acb:0">console.log("hello world");</span></span>

2

<span key="5e2d79bb93ce449bb2be42f51b079a1a"><span offset-key="5e2d79bb93ce449bb2be42f51b079a1a:0">console.log("how are you?");</span></span>

1

<span key="f1e773bf37764eff963fcb047b5929c1"><span offset-key="f1e773bf37764eff963fcb047b5929c1:0">hello world</span></span>

2

<span key="89b2300fdb094d5a96ef4a407ec523e6"><span offset-key="89b2300fdb094d5a96ef4a407ec523e6:0">how are you?</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

<span key="2dccec819bb14f20a00b033edf5d6e5f"><span offset-key="2dccec819bb14f20a00b033edf5d6e5f:0">Nothing too ground breaking here, but pay close attention to the exact way we wrote the program. In particular, notice how we lay out the periods, parentheses, and quotation marks. We’ll also terminate lines with semicolons (;).</span></span>

> <span key="cc07d846b2c44136b547d54ef9d7cfe0">*Depending on how you structure your code, sometimes you’ll be able to omit semicolons at the end of lines. For now, you’ll want to include them just as we do.*</span>

## 

<span key="cee41aedfec143f4b9d7e009b753563d"><span offset-key="cee41aedfec143f4b9d7e009b753563d:0">Syntax</span></span>

<span key="1941cc13fd9e4b85ae394ec49fd22eca"><span offset-key="1941cc13fd9e4b85ae394ec49fd22eca:0">We refer to the exact arrangement of the symbols, characters, and keywords as </span>**syntax**<span offset-key="1941cc13fd9e4b85ae394ec49fd22eca:2">. These details matter — your computer will only be able to “understand” proper JavaScript syntax. A programming language is similar to a spoken language. A spoken language like English has grammar rules that we should follow in order to be understood by fellow speakers. In the same way, a programming language like JavaScript has syntax rules that we ought to follow!</span></span>

<span key="3aeba5d50f96477eab7d3ac6986a4c19"><span offset-key="3aeba5d50f96477eab7d3ac6986a4c19:0">As you write your first lines of code in this new language, you may make many syntax errors. Don’t get frustrated! This is normal — all new programmers go through this phase. Every time we recognize an error in our code, we have an opportunity to reinforce your understanding of correct syntax. Adopt a growth mindset and learn from your mistakes.</span></span>

<span key="cca74a386b4f40e6b19a93e416b60f59"><span offset-key="cca74a386b4f40e6b19a93e416b60f59:0">Additionally, one of the best things about programming is that we can get such immediate feedback from our creations. There is no penalty for making a mistake when programming. Write some code, run the code, read the errors, fix the errors, rinse and repeat!</span></span>

## 

<span key="1ea8deaff66c4bb8ae97e2469b4d7193"><span offset-key="1ea8deaff66c4bb8ae97e2469b4d7193:0">Code comments</span></span>

<span key="73c4f6faf51e41588972e19a5a85588b"><span offset-key="73c4f6faf51e41588972e19a5a85588b:0">Occasionally we’ll want to leave </span>**comments**<span offset-key="73c4f6faf51e41588972e19a5a85588b:2"> or notes in our code. Commented lines will be ignored by our computer. This means that we can use comments to write plain english or temporarily avoid execution of some JavaScript lines. The proper </span>*syntax*<span offset-key="73c4f6faf51e41588972e19a5a85588b:4"> for writing a comment is to begin the line with double forward slashes (</span>`//`<span offset-key="73c4f6faf51e41588972e19a5a85588b:6">):</span></span>

1

<span key="8ab8a920cad4488c890e2198dce336df"><span offset-key="8ab8a920cad4488c890e2198dce336df:0">// let's write another program!!!</span></span>

2

<span key="f42b826c01de4ec387641917f76547f8"><span offset-key="f42b826c01de4ec387641917f76547f8:0">console.log("hello world");</span></span>

3

<span key="7019653d331b4dd3ad7ee0b2af42ad1f"><span offset-key="7019653d331b4dd3ad7ee0b2af42ad1f:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="d52bf16ae2b543b19fdc815c7251d37e"><span offset-key="d52bf16ae2b543b19fdc815c7251d37e:0">// console.log("how are you?");</span></span>

5

<span key="72fb796f8b63402cbf9f86508b215ab7"><span offset-key="72fb796f8b63402cbf9f86508b215ab7:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

6

<span key="d3a4d8bc6fce4c6f86f9d50133576c73"><span offset-key="d3a4d8bc6fce4c6f86f9d50133576c73:0">console.log("goodbye moon");</span></span>

1

<span key="bdefe8abfbb6487b8038443278745903"><span offset-key="bdefe8abfbb6487b8038443278745903:0">hello world</span></span>

2

<span key="0a070484211d43f197621e6d1cb30d66"><span offset-key="0a070484211d43f197621e6d1cb30d66:0">goodbye moon</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

<span key="5fa41d6c37994493a42d8294015246a1"><span offset-key="5fa41d6c37994493a42d8294015246a1:0">Comments are useful when annotating pieces of code to offer an explanation of how the code works. We’ll want to strive to write straightforward code that is self-explanatory when possible, but we can also use comments to add additional clarity. The real art of programming is to write code so elegantly that it is easy to follow.</span></span>

<span key="efd3d7b47e664581b858da2a0aff216f">**The Number Data Type**</span>

<span key="2481bb43251246d39f18ff0311d3d4db"><span offset-key="2481bb43251246d39f18ff0311d3d4db:0">The </span>**number**<span offset-key="2481bb43251246d39f18ff0311d3d4db:2"> data type in JS is used to represent any numerical values, including integers and decimal numbers.</span></span>

<span key="d7d1a2af2a174ce2acd7a88f04efee17">**Basic Arithmetic Operators**</span>

<span key="674b7decc4ac4a8c96bb425703286912"><span offset-key="674b7decc4ac4a8c96bb425703286912:0">Operators are the symbols that perform particular operations.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="e210358e6c5a4ab6ad7553f267bfd365">**+**<span offset-key="e210358e6c5a4ab6ad7553f267bfd365:1"> (addition)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="07ea59f815084f2694612378864606f8">**-**<span offset-key="07ea59f815084f2694612378864606f8:1"> (subtraction)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="66a67ef1f4bf47dcab3264751ed379d4">**asterisk**<span offset-key="66a67ef1f4bf47dcab3264751ed379d4:1"> (multiplication)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d96e16ee0530447ca848da912bc486e6">**/**<span offset-key="d96e16ee0530447ca848da912bc486e6:1"> (division)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2623c7b31ccd44c5a1bab878833453ce">**%**<span offset-key="2623c7b31ccd44c5a1bab878833453ce:1"> (modulo)</span></span>

<span key="58ffe70fd0f14e6f87511b9aa21a5d38"><span offset-key="58ffe70fd0f14e6f87511b9aa21a5d38:0">JS evaluates more complex expressions using the general math order of operations aka PEMDAS.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b183a4dbb080426391eda12f2fec38e8">**PEMDAS**<span offset-key="b183a4dbb080426391eda12f2fec38e8:1"> : Parentheses, Exponents, Multiplication, Division, Modulo, Addition, Subtraction.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5d060f28d7294989ae2adfca1cff7811">*To force a specific order of operation, use the group operator ( ) around a part of the expression.*</span>

<span key="9b10883fd7a34353b25178bd6ce66e43">**Modulo**<span offset-key="9b10883fd7a34353b25178bd6ce66e43:1"> : Very useful operation to check divisibility of numbers, check for even & odd, whether a number is prime, and much more! </span>*(Discrete Math concept, circular problems can be solved with modulo)*</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="9f249a90312c480297fc86f5fc88ca88"><span offset-key="9f249a90312c480297fc86f5fc88ca88:0">Whenever you have a smaller number % a larger number, the answer will just be the initial small number. console.log(7 % 10) // => 7;</span></span>

<span key="297a6a6563704b45ba3f4edb610f9bd2">**The String Data Type**</span>

<span key="a2f0b1b40e034e519ba61c01e80da9c4"><span offset-key="a2f0b1b40e034e519ba61c01e80da9c4:0">The </span>**string**<span offset-key="a2f0b1b40e034e519ba61c01e80da9c4:2"> data type is a primitive data type that used to represent textual data.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6cfffb42091d41c597c5a22764d81e4e"><span offset-key="6cfffb42091d41c597c5a22764d81e4e:0">can be wrapped by either </span>**single**<span offset-key="6cfffb42091d41c597c5a22764d81e4e:2"> or </span>**double**<span offset-key="6cfffb42091d41c597c5a22764d81e4e:4"> quotation marks, </span>*best to choose one and stick with it for consistency*<span offset-key="6cfffb42091d41c597c5a22764d81e4e:6">.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8c3ff6fb1908484680e8267baa653380"><span offset-key="8c3ff6fb1908484680e8267baa653380:0">If your string contains quotation marks inside, can layer single or double quotation marks to allow it to work. “That’s a great string”; (valid) ‘Shakespeare wrote, “To be or not to be”’; (valid) ‘That’s a bad string’; (invalid)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d5bca8ca78054dffbd2933c911659175"><span offset-key="d5bca8ca78054dffbd2933c911659175:0">Alt. way to add other quotes within strings is to use template literals. \`This is a temp’l’ate literal ${function}\` // use ${} to invoke functions within.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6ff148f435c14fffb7f72387467c1e96">**.length**<span offset-key="6ff148f435c14fffb7f72387467c1e96:1"> : property that can be appended to data to return the length.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b1df084223fc4e4eb7685510abb76dc6"><span offset-key="b1df084223fc4e4eb7685510abb76dc6:0">empty strings have a length of zero.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="0a6b00a898724b5ab854a2665869c3e4">**indices**<span offset-key="0a6b00a898724b5ab854a2665869c3e4:1"> : indexes of data that begin at 0, can call upon index by using the bracket notation \[ \]. console.log(“bootcamp”\[0\]); // => “b” console.log(“bootcamp”\[10\]); // => “undefined” console.log(“boots”\[1 \* 2\]); // => “o” console.log(“boots”\[“boot”.length-1\]); // => “t”</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="39f7d7537a054b799eeb8b947f408eb6"><span offset-key="39f7d7537a054b799eeb8b947f408eb6:0">we can pass expressions through the brackets as well since JS always evaluates expressions first.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c6a1b33353624f78824622bc8a52e459"><span offset-key="c6a1b33353624f78824622bc8a52e459:0">The index of the last character of a string is always one less than it’s length.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="3fb1f7358e9e433485a7c427d04d661a">**indexOf()**<span offset-key="3fb1f7358e9e433485a7c427d04d661a:1"> : method used to find the first index of a given character within a string. console.log(“bagel”.indexOf(“b”)); // => 0 console.log(“bagel”.indexOf(“z”)); // => -1</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4da18f909e3c4b0184fde934be3240d4"><span offset-key="4da18f909e3c4b0184fde934be3240d4:0">if the character inside the indexOf() search does not exist in the string, the output will be -1.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6df39833cfe4426dba377fbaae5148ce"><span offset-key="6df39833cfe4426dba377fbaae5148ce:0">the indexOf() search will return the first instanced index of the the char in the string.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="475228362e02453f95ddb1a7058f306a">**concatenate**<span offset-key="475228362e02453f95ddb1a7058f306a:1"> : word to describe joining strings together into a single string.</span></span>

<span key="f9290c5a250a4d4f9f1b8b383ed89777">**The Boolean Data Type**</span>

<span key="8aff8eb954ac4ea4b7c2b70a73280085"><span offset-key="8aff8eb954ac4ea4b7c2b70a73280085:0">The </span>**Boolean**<span offset-key="8aff8eb954ac4ea4b7c2b70a73280085:2"> data type is the simplest data type since there are only two values: </span>**true**<span offset-key="8aff8eb954ac4ea4b7c2b70a73280085:4"> and </span>**false**<span offset-key="8aff8eb954ac4ea4b7c2b70a73280085:6">.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="678d43ee9986447e8e1adadf82263792">**Logical Operators**<span offset-key="678d43ee9986447e8e1adadf82263792:1"> (B</span>*oolean Operators*<span offset-key="678d43ee9986447e8e1adadf82263792:3">) are used to establish logic in our code.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f6e2c17bc6b14cbd9003fe6ddeaaed95">**!**<span offset-key="f6e2c17bc6b14cbd9003fe6ddeaaed95:1"> (not) : reverses a Boolean value. console.log(!true); // => false console.log(!!false); // => false</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="1bcfef42de244f7b93f2fb12c2855d80">**Logical Order of Operations**<span offset-key="1bcfef42de244f7b93f2fb12c2855d80:1"> : JS will evaluate !, then &&, then ||.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b9495c4b5c8f46e2815d297b57a07268">**Short-Circuit Evaluation**<span offset-key="b9495c4b5c8f46e2815d297b57a07268:1"> : Because JS evalutes from left to right, expressions can “short-circuit”. For example if we have true on the left of an || logical comparison, it will stop evaluating and yield true instead of wasting resources on processing the rest of the statement. console.log(true || !false) // => stops after it sees “true ||”</span></span>

<span key="15cd5b33891f4ac2b76065c8db2c62fb">**Comparison Operators**</span>

<span key="4455bc33bd9f44a2a47291d51e0c375d"><span offset-key="4455bc33bd9f44a2a47291d51e0c375d:0">All comparison operators will result in a boolean output.</span></span>

<span key="5ce52c0c8f42424293be8badaea25dce">**The relative comparators**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2de26d715b4a4fdcb602e3cbb77e30a9">**&gt;**<span offset-key="2de26d715b4a4fdcb602e3cbb77e30a9:1"> (greater than)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="18244dfaf2284b5694beebff421fcb64">**&lt;**<span offset-key="18244dfaf2284b5694beebff421fcb64:1"> (less than)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ba3df42f4bbc4979ad51caae40e95782">**&gt;=**<span offset-key="ba3df42f4bbc4979ad51caae40e95782:1"> (greater than or equal to)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4d2167fe50d34d1881ddbbb447993893">**&lt;=**<span offset-key="4d2167fe50d34d1881ddbbb447993893:1"> (less than or equal to)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a5657ebf1597412f8a0b2fc3013db971">**===**<span offset-key="a5657ebf1597412f8a0b2fc3013db971:1"> (equal to)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8ae563b455b14472848ba190942677c4">**!==**<span offset-key="8ae563b455b14472848ba190942677c4:1"> (not equal to)</span></span>

<span key="0e74c2462f02492d94045f5c768ebfd4"><span offset-key="0e74c2462f02492d94045f5c768ebfd4:0">Fun Fact: “a” &lt; “b” is considered valid JS Code because string comparisons are compared lexicographically (meaning dictionary order), so “a” is less than “b” because it appears earlier!</span></span>

<span key="6dcfc23e6ac24bb48b897037cdd1c59b"><span offset-key="6dcfc23e6ac24bb48b897037cdd1c59b:0">If there is ever a standstill comparison of two string lexicographically (i.e. app vs apple) the comparison will deem the shorter string lesser.</span></span>

<span key="0efc3e03e8104f8f9ddf317e29ea92c6">**Difference between == and ===**</span>

### 

<span key="905c713da2e14a08bc2fe76f48072080"><span offset-key="905c713da2e14a08bc2fe76f48072080:0">===</span></span>

<span key="02dc8e3c109845fa8d47db85d9d9d3ea"><span offset-key="02dc8e3c109845fa8d47db85d9d9d3ea:0">Strict Equality, will only return true if the two comparisons are entirely the same.</span></span>

### 

<span key="6b0f0745278644e6b6e20e4eb095df69"><span offset-key="6b0f0745278644e6b6e20e4eb095df69:0">==</span></span>

<span key="f945274f46d94c05ad84e2eba6825e87"><span offset-key="f945274f46d94c05ad84e2eba6825e87:0">Loose Equality, will return true even if the values are of a different type, due to coercion. (Avoid using this)</span></span>

<span key="fbf0a5b9f4d84df2adb90402231b0728">**Variables**</span>

<span key="0fcc83492f9b45d6ad4a37d6f07f08b7"><span offset-key="0fcc83492f9b45d6ad4a37d6f07f08b7:0">Variables are used to store information to be referenced and manipulated in a program.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="89d1c3d39cbf43cba93a286a0f831382"><span offset-key="89d1c3d39cbf43cba93a286a0f831382:0">We initialize a variable by using the </span>**let**<span offset-key="89d1c3d39cbf43cba93a286a0f831382:2"> keyword and a </span>**=**<span offset-key="89d1c3d39cbf43cba93a286a0f831382:4"> single equals sign (assignment operator). let bootcamp = “App Academy”; console.log(bootcamp); // “App Academy”</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2a38cefebecf41c3b8db04b8baebf9c6"><span offset-key="2a38cefebecf41c3b8db04b8baebf9c6:0">JS variable names can contain any alphanumeric characters, underscores, or dollar signs (cannot being with a number).</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f039423e85a44891bfb714a1759a74fc"><span offset-key="f039423e85a44891bfb714a1759a74fc:0">If you do not declare a value for a variable, undefined is automatically set. let bootcamp; console.log(bootcamp); // undefined</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ab8eb8fd9ef84686bd135197fcc4da8c"><span offset-key="ab8eb8fd9ef84686bd135197fcc4da8c:0">We can change the value of a previously declared variable (let, not const) by re-assigning it another value.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="220e41d46a6f4c81b74f0f685b3c6cd8">**let**<span offset-key="220e41d46a6f4c81b74f0f685b3c6cd8:1"> is the updated version of </span>**var**<span offset-key="220e41d46a6f4c81b74f0f685b3c6cd8:3">; there are some differences in terms of hoisting and global/block scope</span></span>

<span key="bd25b09c01164f66a29cd3815c0af487">**Assignment Shorthand**</span>

<span key="006f9c58474449d9b625dfc9ea76286c"><span offset-key="006f9c58474449d9b625dfc9ea76286c:0">let num = 0; num += 10; // same as num = num + 10 num -= 2; // same as num = num — 2 num /= 4; // same as num = num / 4 num \*= 7; // same as num = num \* 7</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5730f80705b5447094dbf722c6062deb"><span offset-key="5730f80705b5447094dbf722c6062deb:0">In general, any nonsensical arithmetic will result in </span>**NaN**<span offset-key="5730f80705b5447094dbf722c6062deb:2"> ; usually operations that include undefined.</span></span>

<span key="75bf609f00ad4b778f1510f1573799f9">**Functions**</span>

<span key="4a33635ee667469fb086b6f6815fbbb8"><span offset-key="4a33635ee667469fb086b6f6815fbbb8:0">A function is a procedure of code that will run when called. Functions are used so that we do not have to rewrite code to do the same thing over and over. (Think of them as ‘subprograms’)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="158c060a366d42e19f50c769aa375cd9">**Function Declaration**<span offset-key="158c060a366d42e19f50c769aa375cd9:1"> : Process when we first initially write our function.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8c52248d5db54d1faa6b288fa78a08b9"><span offset-key="8c52248d5db54d1faa6b288fa78a08b9:0">Includes three things:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6bd1be777ba04edfb1af26df682dc9a6"><span offset-key="6bd1be777ba04edfb1af26df682dc9a6:0">Name of the function.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f0dc1f978cc3444b872f7ed7d793376a"><span offset-key="f0dc1f978cc3444b872f7ed7d793376a:0">A list of </span>*parameters*<span offset-key="f0dc1f978cc3444b872f7ed7d793376a:2"> ()</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="58dbaeb3352f40f7bb919b07e58ad34a"><span offset-key="58dbaeb3352f40f7bb919b07e58ad34a:0">The code to execute {}</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="dbb52b5451a14d60859b8cb5d16bec31">**Function Calls**<span offset-key="dbb52b5451a14d60859b8cb5d16bec31:1"> : We can call upon our function whenever and wherever\* we want. (\*wherever is only after the initial declaration)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="e0b525f9406b42a9a3db2df8ad4f0b38"><span offset-key="e0b525f9406b42a9a3db2df8ad4f0b38:0">JS evaluates code top down, left to right.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="100ea4f93f034b8280e19e694d8846d4"><span offset-key="100ea4f93f034b8280e19e694d8846d4:0">When we execute a declared function later on in our program we refer to this as </span>**invoking**<span offset-key="100ea4f93f034b8280e19e694d8846d4:2"> our function.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d3de3df047eb4694a14185f380fcc288"><span offset-key="d3de3df047eb4694a14185f380fcc288:0">Every function in JS returns undefined unless otherwise specified.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d0281fe32d384be0981134d0b5d8c3c4"><span offset-key="d0281fe32d384be0981134d0b5d8c3c4:0">When we hit a </span>**return**<span offset-key="d0281fe32d384be0981134d0b5d8c3c4:2"> statement in a function we immediately exit the function and return to where we called the function.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="9b3bb1fe270f446e8b66df6a416a3173"><span offset-key="9b3bb1fe270f446e8b66df6a416a3173:0">When naming functions in JS always use camelCase and name it something appropriate.</span></span>

<span key="971aa066e5094ac799b958af11a741b6"><span offset-key="971aa066e5094ac799b958af11a741b6:0">Greate code reads like English and almost explains itself. Think: Elegant, readable, and maintainable!</span></span>

<span key="8324f7fe86d9452c8ca90f160c4a712a">**Parameters and Arguments**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="be13abc2b27a4bd58b48b97167d9ea9b">**Parameters**<span offset-key="be13abc2b27a4bd58b48b97167d9ea9b:1"> : Comma seperated variables specified as part of a function’s declaration.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8a21d8071c6840e8a74daf5bb1514303">**Arguments**<span offset-key="8a21d8071c6840e8a74daf5bb1514303:1"> : Values passed to the function when it is invoked.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f07b33cfe73c4d679dbee879ade6cea5">*If the number of arguments passed during a function invocation is different than the number of paramters listed, it will still work.*</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="7012976f6579433d837cbfa686c06492"><span offset-key="7012976f6579433d837cbfa686c06492:0">However, is there are not enough arguments provided for parameters our function will likely yield </span>**Nan**<span offset-key="7012976f6579433d837cbfa686c06492:2">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="fc0a17f887a347a0be4e315d613a20e8"><span offset-key="fc0a17f887a347a0be4e315d613a20e8:0">Including Comments</span></span>

<span key="a1815889bf3047d88dfb80e1c178ff40"><span offset-key="a1815889bf3047d88dfb80e1c178ff40:0">Comments are important because they help other people understand what is going on in your code or remind you if you forgot something yourself. Keep in mind that they have to be marked properly so the browser won’t try to execute them.</span></span>

<span key="fb7961a968a640989a83a5f3b2321fc8"><span offset-key="fb7961a968a640989a83a5f3b2321fc8:0">In JavaScript you have two different options:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4a7f23a8030f4a19b1d16aa743764c1f"><span offset-key="4a7f23a8030f4a19b1d16aa743764c1f:0">Single-line comments — To include a comment that is limited to a single line, precede it with </span>`//`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a15d3d63dff64dd483deadd95e05716a"><span offset-key="a15d3d63dff64dd483deadd95e05716a:0">Multi-line comments — In case you want to write longer comments between several lines, wrap it in </span>`/*`<span offset-key="a15d3d63dff64dd483deadd95e05716a:2"> and </span>`*/`<span offset-key="a15d3d63dff64dd483deadd95e05716a:4"> to avoid it from being executed</span></span>

## 

<span key="6c2b5a6e117a4c86977835724caab96c"><span offset-key="6c2b5a6e117a4c86977835724caab96c:0">Variables in JavaScript</span></span>

<span key="444868a970b04d5ba39c263a099ca0fd"><span offset-key="444868a970b04d5ba39c263a099ca0fd:0">Variables are stand-in values that you can use to perform operations. You should be familiar with them from math class.</span></span>

## 

<span key="0cd8f1699563456bb4431660615bd00a"><span offset-key="0cd8f1699563456bb4431660615bd00a:0">var, const, let</span></span>

<span key="e2e77fba555449518621be9c526a5fe5"><span offset-key="e2e77fba555449518621be9c526a5fe5:0">You have three different possibilities for declaring a variable in JavaScript, each with their own specialties:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="cc1cb35d70bc46a29da5b25af29d4049">`var`<span offset-key="cc1cb35d70bc46a29da5b25af29d4049:1"> — The most common variable. It can be reassigned but only accessed within a function. Variables defined with </span>`var`<span offset-key="cc1cb35d70bc46a29da5b25af29d4049:3"> move to the top when the code is executed.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ce116d162b744f2c86877db00c1dc396">`const`<span offset-key="ce116d162b744f2c86877db00c1dc396:1"> — Can not be reassigned and not accessible before they appear within the code.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f0cb35e9a6244630a01b068acc34f7e1">`let`<span offset-key="f0cb35e9a6244630a01b068acc34f7e1:1"> — Similar to </span>`const`<span offset-key="f0cb35e9a6244630a01b068acc34f7e1:3">, the </span>`let`<span offset-key="f0cb35e9a6244630a01b068acc34f7e1:5"> variable can be reassigned but not re-declared.</span></span>

## 

<span key="145ad657a16745cdb40a48f978df67ff"><span offset-key="145ad657a16745cdb40a48f978df67ff:0">Data Types</span></span>

<span key="f9257c4c7a9b46f0a0f4f4b0d60ded5d"><span offset-key="f9257c4c7a9b46f0a0f4f4b0d60ded5d:0">Variables can contain different types of values and data types. You use </span>`=`<span offset-key="f9257c4c7a9b46f0a0f4f4b0d60ded5d:2"> to assign them:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f158c1d63575419ca26aff9144a93b9d"><span offset-key="f158c1d63575419ca26aff9144a93b9d:0">Numbers — </span>`var age = 23`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="856a3172f46640139b5993e271e63db9"><span offset-key="856a3172f46640139b5993e271e63db9:0">Variables — </span>`var x`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c86e580ada0e4c1fa9d187266a53ddf8"><span offset-key="c86e580ada0e4c1fa9d187266a53ddf8:0">Text (strings) — </span>`var a = "init"`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b200f53972a04e86b473a29b732fbc9d"><span offset-key="b200f53972a04e86b473a29b732fbc9d:0">Operations — </span>`var b = 1 + 2 + 3`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f5af76658c614bde853364bbb56dc4ef"><span offset-key="f5af76658c614bde853364bbb56dc4ef:0">True or false statements — </span>`var c = true`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="62cfdd46828543108d3be4890c2ee531"><span offset-key="62cfdd46828543108d3be4890c2ee531:0">Constant numbers — </span>`const PI = 3.14`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="fd2a8dc2e22b494e9e5b7e20881d44a5"><span offset-key="fd2a8dc2e22b494e9e5b7e20881d44a5:0">Objects — </span>`var name = {firstName:"John", lastName:"Doe"}`</span>

<span key="569b6c6fcaaf461f97dc17b771568b6b"><span offset-key="569b6c6fcaaf461f97dc17b771568b6b:0">There are more possibilities. Note that variables are case sensitive. That means </span>`lastname`<span offset-key="569b6c6fcaaf461f97dc17b771568b6b:2"> and </span>`lastName`<span offset-key="569b6c6fcaaf461f97dc17b771568b6b:4"> will be handled as two different variables.</span></span>

## 

<span key="a20b2723252c4d03a35e449f4a043fcf"><span offset-key="a20b2723252c4d03a35e449f4a043fcf:0">Objects</span></span>

<span key="33293d385ca440ca95df54d632dbb7ed"><span offset-key="33293d385ca440ca95df54d632dbb7ed:0">Objects are certain kinds of variables. They are variables that can have their own values and methods. The latter are actions that you can perform on objects.</span></span>

<span key="d7c520b988ba40ac85009fcff96cb520"><span offset-key="d7c520b988ba40ac85009fcff96cb520:0">var person = {</span></span>

<span key="df54236e1fb0471da7baa505c6cb8099"><span offset-key="df54236e1fb0471da7baa505c6cb8099:0">firstName:”John”,</span></span>

<span key="7a26cf47720b425ab04db52c35623d5c"><span offset-key="7a26cf47720b425ab04db52c35623d5c:0">lastName:”Doe”,</span></span>

<span key="73c7beccc3a74650b0f4e6bd9c1ea585"><span offset-key="73c7beccc3a74650b0f4e6bd9c1ea585:0">age:20,</span></span>

<span key="88e3d787b932431aaf03befa940fed3b"><span offset-key="88e3d787b932431aaf03befa940fed3b:0">nationality:”German”</span></span>

<span key="0ddf4fed62d24391a5144024bd436fa0"><span offset-key="0ddf4fed62d24391a5144024bd436fa0:0">};</span></span>

## 

<span key="5e1b1db9800549b09091511d68f22e9c"><span offset-key="5e1b1db9800549b09091511d68f22e9c:0">The Next Level: Arrays</span></span>

<span key="45a149c11271449aa32e67382e7d3c8e"><span offset-key="45a149c11271449aa32e67382e7d3c8e:0">Next up in our JavaScript cheat sheet are arrays. Arrays are part of many different programming languages. They are a way of organizing variables and properties into groups. Here’s how to create one in JavaScript:</span></span>

<span key="fb4fa930c21b4abf83466ffaa23c655d"><span offset-key="fb4fa930c21b4abf83466ffaa23c655d:0">var fruit = \[“Banana”, “Apple”, “Pear”\];</span></span>

<span key="6e7d922d533d4ea88ed1d92a4ccc3b19"><span offset-key="6e7d922d533d4ea88ed1d92a4ccc3b19:0">Now you have an array called </span>`fruit`<span offset-key="6e7d922d533d4ea88ed1d92a4ccc3b19:2"> which contains three items that you can use for future operations.</span></span>

## 

<span key="affd3bceb04948838783cdbe5ec2d9a0"><span offset-key="affd3bceb04948838783cdbe5ec2d9a0:0">Array Methods</span></span>

<span key="b68ab2a891004869b0370867be5bc6df"><span offset-key="b68ab2a891004869b0370867be5bc6df:0">Once you have created arrays, there are a few things you can do with them:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8129dc9ac498491f9173a9c33b093ba3">`concat()`<span offset-key="8129dc9ac498491f9173a9c33b093ba3:1"> — Join several arrays into one</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="84489e58b256422d8892b0672e88a38e">`indexOf()`<span offset-key="84489e58b256422d8892b0672e88a38e:1"> — Returns the first position at which a given element appears in an array</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a57584c4ee724570917a396d72f189e9">`join()`<span offset-key="a57584c4ee724570917a396d72f189e9:1"> — Combine elements of an array into a single string and return the string</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8fb39593157442f1990293e5b28e0685">`lastIndexOf()`<span offset-key="8fb39593157442f1990293e5b28e0685:1"> — Gives the last position at which a given element appears in an array</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="99bc93063bf64771a8dafb73ca9d1104">`pop()`<span offset-key="99bc93063bf64771a8dafb73ca9d1104:1"> — Removes the last element of an array</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8f81608dbf864c4bb93bb2182d1033cf">`push()`<span offset-key="8f81608dbf864c4bb93bb2182d1033cf:1"> — Add a new element at the end</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4c18a11f34d14dd2b50ff420c62c01f1">`reverse()`<span offset-key="4c18a11f34d14dd2b50ff420c62c01f1:1"> — Sort elements in a descending order</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d6424e2b28af4fb9bda24a9bdb7502b9">`shift()`<span offset-key="d6424e2b28af4fb9bda24a9bdb7502b9:1"> — Remove the first element of an array</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6e6fd7a4788c4890a5f4da20a1d1243c">`slice()`<span offset-key="6e6fd7a4788c4890a5f4da20a1d1243c:1"> — Pulls a copy of a portion of an array into a new array</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="7515a35e535b4c74bbcdeca938b05de5">`sort()`<span offset-key="7515a35e535b4c74bbcdeca938b05de5:1"> — Sorts elements alphabetically</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="7fc06bee50c9444484d62117c42ef61f">`splice()`<span offset-key="7fc06bee50c9444484d62117c42ef61f:1"> — Adds elements in a specified way and position</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="80be39c3015646a5a2fa4ba68cbbbb29">`toString()`<span offset-key="80be39c3015646a5a2fa4ba68cbbbb29:1"> — Converts elements to strings</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5d51e8a22eb649e7a84e34ce4e3ff9f3">`unshift()`<span offset-key="5d51e8a22eb649e7a84e34ce4e3ff9f3:1"> —Adds a new element to the beginning</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2d04fce4e7ba4a8c9b7e47c3a9f9f94f">`valueOf()`<span offset-key="2d04fce4e7ba4a8c9b7e47c3a9f9f94f:1"> — Returns the primitive value of the specified object</span></span>

## 

<span key="1af7f06a618742cbb901afce49e4795e"><span offset-key="1af7f06a618742cbb901afce49e4795e:0">Operators</span></span>

<span key="411d3818ec394b0dad43110bd50f9705"><span offset-key="411d3818ec394b0dad43110bd50f9705:0">If you have variables, you can use them to perform different kinds of operations. To do so, you need operators.</span></span>

## 

<span key="2153e3c925e34b64b50d21adf96a11e1"><span offset-key="2153e3c925e34b64b50d21adf96a11e1:0">Basic Operators</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6523150e69b64641b6cbacc09e7f736b">`+`<span offset-key="6523150e69b64641b6cbacc09e7f736b:1"> — Addition</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="0eb7df4c418a435a900a521962cc0930">`-`<span offset-key="0eb7df4c418a435a900a521962cc0930:1"> — Subtraction</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b83851c3c2e941969f7bdaf3fb799a61">`*`<span offset-key="b83851c3c2e941969f7bdaf3fb799a61:1"> — Multiplication</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d2a08410fc8d4297a85a7e446f390347">`/`<span offset-key="d2a08410fc8d4297a85a7e446f390347:1"> — Division</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b44ac31a19f34f0c848e90830cbb669a">`(...)`<span offset-key="b44ac31a19f34f0c848e90830cbb669a:1"> — Grouping operator, operations within brackets are executed earlier than those outside</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="9f7a575ae54b466d9c6a4f3b64f5b931">`%`<span offset-key="9f7a575ae54b466d9c6a4f3b64f5b931:1"> — Modulus (remainder )</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8e95e834ff88457a9438be72b109b37a">`++`<span offset-key="8e95e834ff88457a9438be72b109b37a:1"> — Increment numbers</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="505e489f57a446a084bd5ba15e22b626">`--`<span offset-key="505e489f57a446a084bd5ba15e22b626:1"> — Decrement numbers</span></span>

## 

<span key="b5b766d7c98b43b6aac372c187010d12"><span offset-key="b5b766d7c98b43b6aac372c187010d12:0">Comparison Operators</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="19555841cd0b4e189e3661509049866e">`==`<span offset-key="19555841cd0b4e189e3661509049866e:1"> — Equal to</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2b6aa6692147470cb4e48b927532689d">`===`<span offset-key="2b6aa6692147470cb4e48b927532689d:1"> — Equal value and equal type</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c6ae822d71d5434aba8f979bb2164feb">`!=`<span offset-key="c6ae822d71d5434aba8f979bb2164feb:1"> — Not equal</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4462b8ed1b7a47a38280d591d4816300">`!==`<span offset-key="4462b8ed1b7a47a38280d591d4816300:1"> — Not equal value or not equal type</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8b8209d4f96e40f782a1a0f72777ddec">`>`<span offset-key="8b8209d4f96e40f782a1a0f72777ddec:1"> — Greater than</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2d94f8f8a3e040dabed4595fd30a238b">`<`<span offset-key="2d94f8f8a3e040dabed4595fd30a238b:1"> — Less than</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="81b7c7da90614a86bb5e545d48418722">`>=`<span offset-key="81b7c7da90614a86bb5e545d48418722:1"> — Greater than or equal to</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d44b1ee9534d408c9e334aff91ead807">`<=`<span offset-key="d44b1ee9534d408c9e334aff91ead807:1"> — Less than or equal to</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8f9f551204914a1da18076e1169bfebd">`?`<span offset-key="8f9f551204914a1da18076e1169bfebd:1"> — Ternary operator</span></span>

## 

<span key="8b01d810d79d463db3688cd050768d38"><span offset-key="8b01d810d79d463db3688cd050768d38:0">Logical Operators</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="345a12d0838543a094069d85e3cc5580">`&&`<span offset-key="345a12d0838543a094069d85e3cc5580:1"> — Logical and</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8650061e023a483794b10996502e08ff">`||`<span offset-key="8650061e023a483794b10996502e08ff:1"> — Logical or</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="33789dd429514fecb6b349d1cce2a66a">`!`<span offset-key="33789dd429514fecb6b349d1cce2a66a:1"> — Logical not</span></span>

## 

<span key="da60fcd14b3b4704ac38184f150dec23"><span offset-key="da60fcd14b3b4704ac38184f150dec23:0">Bitwise Operators</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="9b1425f3a92f4573924c4ba7815a5f12">`&`<span offset-key="9b1425f3a92f4573924c4ba7815a5f12:1"> — AND statement</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="217ebe5734c54784b678703bc16b6629">`|`<span offset-key="217ebe5734c54784b678703bc16b6629:1"> — OR statement</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="fd85f77a6c504020bda9a083139f5e34">`~`<span offset-key="fd85f77a6c504020bda9a083139f5e34:1"> — NOT</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="fd03c98abcf74c21afa3ecf31262923c">`^`<span offset-key="fd03c98abcf74c21afa3ecf31262923c:1"> — XOR</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="48e60b33eaad47ddbb4a0b0e2a0f1a81">`<<`<span offset-key="48e60b33eaad47ddbb4a0b0e2a0f1a81:1"> — Left shift</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a9dfa0c729df479da2a87fa5e12e5fe7">`>>`<span offset-key="a9dfa0c729df479da2a87fa5e12e5fe7:1"> — Right shift</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="77a8abdd81614e97a0a7cbb3ca93bbb1">`>>>`<span offset-key="77a8abdd81614e97a0a7cbb3ca93bbb1:1"> — Zero fill right shift</span></span>

## 

<span key="df90678b56e441fb80bd8c3dd46445f7"><span offset-key="df90678b56e441fb80bd8c3dd46445f7:0">Functions</span></span>

<span key="89c575d7d2a64c1692288a128a1a5c39"><span offset-key="89c575d7d2a64c1692288a128a1a5c39:0">JavaScript functions are blocks of code that perform a certain task. A basic function looks like this:</span></span>

<span key="8a7791ba4b5e4de597aeecc60c2cf187"><span offset-key="8a7791ba4b5e4de597aeecc60c2cf187:0">function name(parameter1, parameter2, parameter3) {</span></span>

<span key="6de1a892a845470dac70d9bc26c18215"><span offset-key="6de1a892a845470dac70d9bc26c18215:0">// what the function does</span></span>

<span key="15497a667a6d447da0e58ea701f145fa"><span offset-key="15497a667a6d447da0e58ea701f145fa:0">}</span></span>

<span key="a7b14a1f8c4149a28bd580046b814e80"><span offset-key="a7b14a1f8c4149a28bd580046b814e80:0">As you can see, it consists of the </span>`function`<span offset-key="a7b14a1f8c4149a28bd580046b814e80:2"> keyword plus a name. The function’s parameters are in the brackets and you have curly brackets around what the function performs. You can create your own, but to make your life easier – there are also a number of default functions.</span></span>

## 

<span key="6ae81b6a67414c1d84a328ea8ce4193d"><span offset-key="6ae81b6a67414c1d84a328ea8ce4193d:0">Outputting Data</span></span>

<span key="4cd82bc560f4485aa50bc1e5a3e24b14"><span offset-key="4cd82bc560f4485aa50bc1e5a3e24b14:0">A common application for functions is the output of data. For the output, you have the following options:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a95f12ee89fa4beda9d1d55200784403">`alert()`<span offset-key="a95f12ee89fa4beda9d1d55200784403:1"> — Output data in an alert box in the browser window</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ab64c3651573431ba950ab103c3951a6">`confirm()`<span offset-key="ab64c3651573431ba950ab103c3951a6:1"> — Opens up a yes/no dialog and returns true/false depending on user click</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="aea4a271992048e99bb11d1053fed7c2">`console.log()`<span offset-key="aea4a271992048e99bb11d1053fed7c2:1"> — Writes information to the browser console, good for debugging purposes</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4fd5b22131c54c988ef95b627889f9c5">`document.write()`<span offset-key="4fd5b22131c54c988ef95b627889f9c5:1"> — Write directly to the HTML document</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="feae0971a7e44051a70541ec85476fb4">`prompt()`<span offset-key="feae0971a7e44051a70541ec85476fb4:1"> — Creates a dialogue for user input</span></span>

## 

<span key="b56c60835e6540ae9dec0110749e3afc"><span offset-key="b56c60835e6540ae9dec0110749e3afc:0">Global Functions</span></span>

<span key="4bc7c1e2a83e4e3c947b2379cf9b314a"><span offset-key="4bc7c1e2a83e4e3c947b2379cf9b314a:0">Global functions are functions built into every browser capable of running JavaScript.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f9948467e3204d2ca84c1f3d565c8421">`decodeURI()`<span offset-key="f9948467e3204d2ca84c1f3d565c8421:1"> — Decodes a </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource_Identifier" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="97fd257c421a4fa1ba00be5f9d85f213" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-58691_259-58692-237__"><span data-key="4229346434984b369e101fc24d0a3475"><span data-offset-key="4229346434984b369e101fc24d0a3475:0">Uniform Resource Identifier (URI)</span></span></span></a><span key="c1112613b01d475a9e9d7d77afa45f16"><span offset-key="c1112613b01d475a9e9d7d77afa45f16:0"> created by </span>`encodeURI`<span offset-key="c1112613b01d475a9e9d7d77afa45f16:2"> or similar</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c9f1cfb806634c23945f87d881371b89">`decodeURIComponent()`<span offset-key="c9f1cfb806634c23945f87d881371b89:1"> — Decodes a URI component</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="dc16c33a001b47e88214749478f08a44">`encodeURI()`<span offset-key="dc16c33a001b47e88214749478f08a44:1"> — Encodes a URI into UTF-8</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="7e72a89ac244408f9e7f0d7423f80da1">`encodeURIComponent()`<span offset-key="7e72a89ac244408f9e7f0d7423f80da1:1"> — Same but for URI components</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ab92811e353a4152b0936083bef583c0">`eval()`<span offset-key="ab92811e353a4152b0936083bef583c0:1"> — Evaluates JavaScript code represented as a string</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d78fd77bb8de4fc58242bcef9ad91b7b">`isFinite()`<span offset-key="d78fd77bb8de4fc58242bcef9ad91b7b:1"> — Determines whether a passed value is a finite number</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="45536105c2aa47b9aceef78e46af9a6e">`isNaN()`<span offset-key="45536105c2aa47b9aceef78e46af9a6e:1"> — Determines whether a value is NaN or not</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="1f68abc883e74242828a64e0cd699b77">`Number()`<span offset-key="1f68abc883e74242828a64e0cd699b77:1"> —- Returns a number converted from its argument</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d21f91238fac494d943f31b2d87fe263">`parseFloat()`<span offset-key="d21f91238fac494d943f31b2d87fe263:1"> — Parses an argument and returns a floating-point number</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="fa246bd34a484b44927c7ad7ad1f3160">`parseInt()`<span offset-key="fa246bd34a484b44927c7ad7ad1f3160:1"> — Parses its argument and returns an integer</span></span>

## 

<span key="da9a246269dc414ba6b7d9e449cb43d1"><span offset-key="da9a246269dc414ba6b7d9e449cb43d1:0">JavaScript Loops</span></span>

<span key="95601659d1374486bce7cba2160c4e96"><span offset-key="95601659d1374486bce7cba2160c4e96:0">Loops are part of most programming languages. They allow you to execute blocks of code desired number of times with different values:</span></span>

<span key="c7f78deca5234c61bab45faabf991ca5"><span offset-key="c7f78deca5234c61bab45faabf991ca5:0">for (before loop; condition </span>**for**<span offset-key="c7f78deca5234c61bab45faabf991ca5:2"> loop; execute after loop) {</span></span>

<span key="2d8886699ef14fb79cb577d220a3419d"><span offset-key="2d8886699ef14fb79cb577d220a3419d:0">// what to do during the loop</span></span>

<span key="09aabb981148454eba20e45a6caf7736"><span offset-key="09aabb981148454eba20e45a6caf7736:0">}</span></span>

<span key="df0d843437934bd0b21233c2bb280446"><span offset-key="df0d843437934bd0b21233c2bb280446:0">You have several parameters to create loops:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2453f4844c4e4602b54b4f90439adec4">`for`<span offset-key="2453f4844c4e4602b54b4f90439adec4:1"> — The most common way to create a loop in JavaScript</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5bae4ed8ba0f4490ab26f97ec6024dc8">`while`<span offset-key="5bae4ed8ba0f4490ab26f97ec6024dc8:1"> — Sets up conditions under which a loop executes</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ec8749be50974fbb9654f16be7a4dd4b">`do while`<span offset-key="ec8749be50974fbb9654f16be7a4dd4b:1"> — Similar to the </span>`while`<span offset-key="ec8749be50974fbb9654f16be7a4dd4b:3"> loop but it executes at least once and performs a check at the end to see if the condition is met to execute again</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="3e8eeb4c4fba4bccbf46451cc1ae8d9a">`break`<span offset-key="3e8eeb4c4fba4bccbf46451cc1ae8d9a:1"> —Used to stop and exit the cycle at certain conditions</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="1e87f881d52643ce8581aed8c4a2568e">`continue`<span offset-key="1e87f881d52643ce8581aed8c4a2568e:1"> — Skip parts of the cycle if certain conditions are met</span></span>

## 

<span key="845cf22c819246aa88d3e3f88d328c42"><span offset-key="845cf22c819246aa88d3e3f88d328c42:0">If — Else Statements</span></span>

<span key="5ed9ca0657be4a2cb64d37f153888b90"><span offset-key="5ed9ca0657be4a2cb64d37f153888b90:0">These types of statements are easy to understand. Using them, you can set conditions for when your code is executed. If certain conditions apply, something is done, if not — something else is executed.</span></span>

<span key="d79ee5f89f6f4ca1a6b992f78ef58c40"><span offset-key="d79ee5f89f6f4ca1a6b992f78ef58c40:0">if (condition) {</span></span>

<span key="ef9dc29482844b3a865d5369485f6783"><span offset-key="ef9dc29482844b3a865d5369485f6783:0">// what to do if condition is met</span></span>

<span key="d3acf6e88ab647c4b00c550388586d44"><span offset-key="d3acf6e88ab647c4b00c550388586d44:0">} </span>**else**<span offset-key="d3acf6e88ab647c4b00c550388586d44:2"> {</span></span>

<span key="4548f34fe94448159cb0e858b67c79df"><span offset-key="4548f34fe94448159cb0e858b67c79df:0">// what to do if condition is not met</span></span>

<span key="1bf1b2cb0a13404eaef77aeff423e284"><span offset-key="1bf1b2cb0a13404eaef77aeff423e284:0">}</span></span>

<span key="d96a34d890114f83bf2830fcd759e577"><span offset-key="d96a34d890114f83bf2830fcd759e577:0">A similar concept to </span>`if else`<span offset-key="d96a34d890114f83bf2830fcd759e577:2"> is the </span>`switch`<span offset-key="d96a34d890114f83bf2830fcd759e577:4"> statement. However, using the switch you select one of several code blocks to execute.</span></span>

## 

<span key="dc7aa10812d040b198f87165b717b225"><span offset-key="dc7aa10812d040b198f87165b717b225:0">Strings</span></span>

<span key="b5a388458f104ac2a3dbe1ac47a51a39"><span offset-key="b5a388458f104ac2a3dbe1ac47a51a39:0">Strings are what JavaScript calls to text that does not perform a function but can appear on the screen.</span></span>

<span key="58f2c28695574aa9b9a10994d0fd5107"><span offset-key="58f2c28695574aa9b9a10994d0fd5107:0">var person = “John Doe”;</span></span>

<span key="4a233516eb61461ea25ca4564d8da99f"><span offset-key="4a233516eb61461ea25ca4564d8da99f:0">In this case, </span>`John Doe`<span offset-key="4a233516eb61461ea25ca4564d8da99f:2"> is the string.</span></span>

## 

<span key="f8c3978d980a468db5645c7ede676405"><span offset-key="f8c3978d980a468db5645c7ede676405:0">Escape Characters</span></span>

<span key="f8cdb8b0f1684c4cb224136ae1b6b2f5"><span offset-key="f8cdb8b0f1684c4cb224136ae1b6b2f5:0">In JavaScript, strings are marked with single or double-quotes. If you want to use quotation marks in a string, you need to use special characters:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c6e77ca56aae447796c91f8e50dfce30">`\'`<span offset-key="c6e77ca56aae447796c91f8e50dfce30:1"> — Single quote</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="58c250bcd11e44b4ae8c46cacd9aa56e">`\"`<span offset-key="58c250bcd11e44b4ae8c46cacd9aa56e:1"> — Double quote</span></span>

<span key="f03ea1d4bcaa429a86da305b0a0fa5d5"><span offset-key="f03ea1d4bcaa429a86da305b0a0fa5d5:0">Aside from that you also have additional escape characters:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c8021c96e3df48e79e8394eee11ded7f">`\\`<span offset-key="c8021c96e3df48e79e8394eee11ded7f:1"> — Backslash</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f39a8242189d483ba032bf985008f1c5">`\b`<span offset-key="f39a8242189d483ba032bf985008f1c5:1"> — Backspace</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="696a31af3da048a88a463d2940a37abe">`\f`<span offset-key="696a31af3da048a88a463d2940a37abe:1"> — Form feed</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b80fa7e827034791990937d015448046"><span offset-key="b80fa7e827034791990937d015448046:0"> — New line</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6a4513837d9f4cf2abf2959286569f6b"><span offset-key="6a4513837d9f4cf2abf2959286569f6b:0"> — Carriage return</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6a80787c4f52492aa4d9603c11119ee5"><span offset-key="6a80787c4f52492aa4d9603c11119ee5:0"> — Horizontal tabulator</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="9a447ae7487e4970815d3e5d12f93fb8">`\v`<span offset-key="9a447ae7487e4970815d3e5d12f93fb8:1"> — Vertical tabulator</span></span>

## 

<span key="3af19457bede4bc3a96d7b0e058884e5"><span offset-key="3af19457bede4bc3a96d7b0e058884e5:0">String Methods</span></span>

<span key="f78e66abdd7d4e16b6b983a077d2676e"><span offset-key="f78e66abdd7d4e16b6b983a077d2676e:0">There are many different ways to work with strings:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="905812d196e64858babc043157b6b155">`charAt()`<span offset-key="905812d196e64858babc043157b6b155:1"> — Returns a character at a specified position inside a string</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ef9f564dfbb64d708ddc38cad46909ec">`charCodeAt()`<span offset-key="ef9f564dfbb64d708ddc38cad46909ec:1"> — Gives you the Unicode of a character at that position</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="99f321a0915548d08c2ece00655afd4b">`concat()`<span offset-key="99f321a0915548d08c2ece00655afd4b:1"> — Concatenates (joins) two or more strings into one</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="9244a299eada45f6a89496319cacedbc">`fromCharCode()`<span offset-key="9244a299eada45f6a89496319cacedbc:1"> — Returns a string created from the specified sequence of UTF-16 code units</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f01ac84b65854c818a4d56980cda1da3">`indexOf()`<span offset-key="f01ac84b65854c818a4d56980cda1da3:1"> — Provides the position of the first occurrence of a specified text within a string</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="166d956dfb414bccb3bf245012ef529a">`lastIndexOf()`<span offset-key="166d956dfb414bccb3bf245012ef529a:1"> — Same as </span>`indexOf()`<span offset-key="166d956dfb414bccb3bf245012ef529a:3"> but with the last occurrence, searching backward</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="80c72ac25f844f31b85116ab875483f8">`match()`<span offset-key="80c72ac25f844f31b85116ab875483f8:1"> — Retrieves the matches of a string against a search pattern</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="dc475097c4784555a5b7d7d109f2e7d8">`replace()`<span offset-key="dc475097c4784555a5b7d7d109f2e7d8:1"> — Find and replace specified text in a string</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="35889424341b4cb5855af1208eb1fc0a">`search()`<span offset-key="35889424341b4cb5855af1208eb1fc0a:1"> — Executes a search for a matching text and returns its position</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="1899e8e54a2b4b9e9a14babe873ea64b">`slice()`<span offset-key="1899e8e54a2b4b9e9a14babe873ea64b:1"> — Extracts a section of a string and returns it as a new string</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="72a6a4b004564d6f9cb363645f9dcd5e">`split()`<span offset-key="72a6a4b004564d6f9cb363645f9dcd5e:1"> — Splits a string object into an array of strings at a specified position</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="1dfb2557a7ae4b5bb4b4722227479a23">`substr()`<span offset-key="1dfb2557a7ae4b5bb4b4722227479a23:1"> — Similar to </span>`slice()`<span offset-key="1dfb2557a7ae4b5bb4b4722227479a23:3"> but extracts a substring depending on a specified number of characters</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8e35b8ae9b08465586e04fd305239ffb">`substring()`<span offset-key="8e35b8ae9b08465586e04fd305239ffb:1"> — Also similar to </span>`slice()`<span offset-key="8e35b8ae9b08465586e04fd305239ffb:3"> but can’t accept negative indices</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4e52ec72a3b24b3e8f6a60d237ff70ed">`toLowerCase()`<span offset-key="4e52ec72a3b24b3e8f6a60d237ff70ed:1"> — Convert strings to lower case</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ae3a8e3ba5214720afb0e02d3e6c399a">`toUpperCase()`<span offset-key="ae3a8e3ba5214720afb0e02d3e6c399a:1"> — Convert strings to upper case</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="374557dc1ffb47c8a308f2b70d79d1fe">`valueOf()`<span offset-key="374557dc1ffb47c8a308f2b70d79d1fe:1"> — Returns the primitive value (that has no properties or methods) of a string object</span></span>

## 

<span key="116a3fe0b1594214b39e4d62715eceb0"><span offset-key="116a3fe0b1594214b39e4d62715eceb0:0">Regular Expression Syntax</span></span>

<span key="08cebb2482164e2e98818442a1ae3555"><span offset-key="08cebb2482164e2e98818442a1ae3555:0">Regular expressions are search patterns used to match character combinations in strings. The search pattern can be used for text search and text to replace operations.</span></span>

## 

<span key="34cda0cfcb194c6fbdc72d36c5a788f4"><span offset-key="34cda0cfcb194c6fbdc72d36c5a788f4:0">Pattern Modifiers</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="350de127414f40318d2816aa6bfffaed">`e`<span offset-key="350de127414f40318d2816aa6bfffaed:1"> — Evaluate replacement</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="fa5658a0db5c4902b679f19691ca825b">`n+`<span offset-key="fa5658a0db5c4902b679f19691ca825b:1"> — Matches any string that contains at least one n</span></span>

## 

<span key="1401e992347d4130935e46f866f3a95a"><span offset-key="1401e992347d4130935e46f866f3a95a:0">DOM Mode</span></span>

<span key="e6f70ab8da4149f7a854802c65a6c105"><span offset-key="e6f70ab8da4149f7a854802c65a6c105:0">The DOM is the </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Document_Object_Model" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a971bda934ee44359a014985df0becd4" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-58691_259-58692-237__"><span data-key="33df39b21420443db0a81cdaf2baac2b"><span data-offset-key="33df39b21420443db0a81cdaf2baac2b:0">Document Object Model</span></span></span></a><span key="c447b39f902b48ce980b1eedc38af310"><span offset-key="c447b39f902b48ce980b1eedc38af310:0"> of a page. It is the code of the structure of a webpage. JavaScript comes with a lot of different ways to create and manipulate HTML elements (called nodes).</span></span>

    <span key="fdc5004f9b174126bd265c3ea83ba57a">`getAttributeNode()`<span offset-key="fdc5004f9b174126bd265c3ea83ba57a:1"> — Gets the specified attribute node</span></span>

    <span key="50eff8c8641e42618b83616d0e2cbe6a">`getAttributeNodeNS()`<span offset-key="50eff8c8641e42618b83616d0e2cbe6a:1"> — Returns the attribute node for the attribute with the given namespace and name</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="41466cbb8b2d4b38bd4e67314dbd8120">`removeAttribute()`<span offset-key="41466cbb8b2d4b38bd4e67314dbd8120:1"> — Removes a specified attribute from an element</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="663424b4a9e54db08508ecf9a431d5a2">`setAttributeNS()`<span offset-key="663424b4a9e54db08508ecf9a431d5a2:1"> — Adds a new attribute or changes the value of an attribute with the given namespace and name</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="841eb0f8ccac4f69a3cc939526b71e8a">`setAttributeNode()`<span offset-key="841eb0f8ccac4f69a3cc939526b71e8a:1"> — Sets or changes the specified attribute node</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="e1e6b6709f424fc89d418cec69bf82ac">`setAttributeNodeNS()`<span offset-key="e1e6b6709f424fc89d418cec69bf82ac:1"> — Adds a new namespaced attribute node to an element</span></span>

## 

<span key="0f186f9243dc48db8b25a62cb96c6745"><span offset-key="0f186f9243dc48db8b25a62cb96c6745:0">Working with the User Browser</span></span>

<span key="d307b99b16e344a0bd352caa732f553d"><span offset-key="d307b99b16e344a0bd352caa732f553d:0">Besides HTML elements, JavaScript is also able to take into account the user browser and incorporate its properties into the code.</span></span>

## 

<span key="248180a8833e4df9acbcd0f9ecef4f5d"><span offset-key="248180a8833e4df9acbcd0f9ecef4f5d:0">Window Properties</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="606e1d42eea241a098b516cc3aca6fc0">`closed`<span offset-key="606e1d42eea241a098b516cc3aca6fc0:1"> — Checks whether a window has been closed or not and returns true or false</span></span>

    <span key="f398a99f067a40d694c2440aed039bb4">`defaultStatus`<span offset-key="f398a99f067a40d694c2440aed039bb4:1"> — Sets or returns the default text in the status bar of a window</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="3bafaa7c32e14c008df41392a1bbf8f7">`history`<span offset-key="3bafaa7c32e14c008df41392a1bbf8f7:1"> — Provides the History object for the window</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="3bdd9ba34a6b44a8bab0e4243541eabd">`innerHeight`<span offset-key="3bdd9ba34a6b44a8bab0e4243541eabd:1"> — The inner height of a window’s content area</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="55541cf8086d486e831a84469664cc1e">`location`<span offset-key="55541cf8086d486e831a84469664cc1e:1"> — Returns the location object for the window</span></span>

    <span key="3d14afcea7544dd2b3c3e51d134ab030">`opener`<span offset-key="3d14afcea7544dd2b3c3e51d134ab030:1"> — Returns a reference to the window that created the window</span></span>

    <span key="9d733c2a695647a6a17e456e94846e3a">`screenY`<span offset-key="9d733c2a695647a6a17e456e94846e3a:1"> — Same as </span>`screenTop`<span offset-key="9d733c2a695647a6a17e456e94846e3a:3"> but needed for some browsers</span></span>

    <span key="af9eec8e724a4a14a9f12d66e063f96f">`top`<span offset-key="af9eec8e724a4a14a9f12d66e063f96f:1"> — Returns the topmost browser window</span></span>

## 

<span key="e32568c27a76404382b09f34f5f47b45"><span offset-key="e32568c27a76404382b09f34f5f47b45:0">Window Methods</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="e08bb40464f940adb2e41babe7590005">`clearInterval()`<span offset-key="e08bb40464f940adb2e41babe7590005:1"> — Clears a timer set with </span>`setInterval()`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a5c3ebce6d354fa7a40e7ffe792ceb1f">`clearTimeout()`<span offset-key="a5c3ebce6d354fa7a40e7ffe792ceb1f:1"> — Clears a timer set with </span>`setTimeout()`</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6f1f24d6fb31436d84e87a36bd808cf6">`confirm()`<span offset-key="6f1f24d6fb31436d84e87a36bd808cf6:1"> — Displays a dialogue box with a message and an </span>*OK*<span offset-key="6f1f24d6fb31436d84e87a36bd808cf6:3"> and </span>*Cancel*<span offset-key="6f1f24d6fb31436d84e87a36bd808cf6:5"> button</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2bccfbfb68364fdd99fe3de91c3c0cbd">`prompt()`<span offset-key="2bccfbfb68364fdd99fe3de91c3c0cbd:1"> — Displays a dialogue box that prompts the visitor for input</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

## 

<span key="ae3863b4d5264f89807eaa1a38260cb5"><span offset-key="ae3863b4d5264f89807eaa1a38260cb5:0">JavaScript Events</span></span>

<span key="e729cfc833394e0eadac69ea771779b2"><span offset-key="e729cfc833394e0eadac69ea771779b2:0">Events are things that can happen to HTML elements and are performed by the user. The programming language can listen for these events and trigger actions in the code. No JavaScript cheat sheet would be complete without them.</span></span>

## 

<span key="75eed55f1ce54901b78425d54cb34dfe"><span offset-key="75eed55f1ce54901b78425d54cb34dfe:0">Mouse</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="e9d0ebadb8af4cc2aa00a88962bc95d1">`onclick`<span offset-key="e9d0ebadb8af4cc2aa00a88962bc95d1:1"> — The event occurs when the user clicks on an element</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5a9e7ffc88474985882020edcd214ccb">`oncontextmenu`<span offset-key="5a9e7ffc88474985882020edcd214ccb:1"> — User right-clicks on an element to open a context menu</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2c16dbbccfe8427092a4bcb53dc50589">`onmouseenter`<span offset-key="2c16dbbccfe8427092a4bcb53dc50589:1"> — The pointer moves onto an element</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="0bd591a6bee04315bd266e04c8b41b40">`onmouseleave`<span offset-key="0bd591a6bee04315bd266e04c8b41b40:1"> — Pointer moves out of an element</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="93562926ed534983a1742c14d3075d19">`onmouseover`<span offset-key="93562926ed534983a1742c14d3075d19:1"> — When the pointer is moved onto an element or one of its children</span></span>

    <span key="815ad3ad069f44a0a37ec440df7ffac5">`onmouseup`<span offset-key="815ad3ad069f44a0a37ec440df7ffac5:1"> — The user releases a mouse button while over an element</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="71cc4bbfedb142a5a3cb56759f242f51">`onkeydown`<span offset-key="71cc4bbfedb142a5a3cb56759f242f51:1"> — When the user is pressing a key down</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="e8dfeb5a4f544cd69ac2605d7c8a2cf4">`onkeypress`<span offset-key="e8dfeb5a4f544cd69ac2605d7c8a2cf4:1"> — The moment the user starts pressing a key</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c87b1b0a86524056bfced1e787618231">`onkeyup`<span offset-key="c87b1b0a86524056bfced1e787618231:1"> — The user releases a key</span></span>

    <span key="c7415120bf2648c2b02dd2c5fa7cacea">`onabort`<span offset-key="c7415120bf2648c2b02dd2c5fa7cacea:1"> — The loading of a media is aborted</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5b4e564a0d064e5a827a5e1a27502ae1">`onerror`<span offset-key="5b4e564a0d064e5a827a5e1a27502ae1:1"> — An error occurs while loading an external file</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="34dc5640e59f46fcb03a6fcc2d2c84ef">`onhashchange`<span offset-key="34dc5640e59f46fcb03a6fcc2d2c84ef:1"> — There have been changes to the anchor part of a URL</span></span>

    <span key="2c9a5cc6d43e4297bb6610e048ef5119">`onresize`<span offset-key="2c9a5cc6d43e4297bb6610e048ef5119:1"> — The document view is resized</span></span>

##

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d0962e8c653545259ffe9d9d6cd49041">`onchange`<span offset-key="d0962e8c653545259ffe9d9d6cd49041:1"> — The content of a form element changes (for </span>`<input>`<span offset-key="d0962e8c653545259ffe9d9d6cd49041:3">, </span>`<select>`<span offset-key="d0962e8c653545259ffe9d9d6cd49041:5"> and </span>`<textarea>`<span offset-key="d0962e8c653545259ffe9d9d6cd49041:7">)</span></span>

    <span key="9205b6d7aea846ca9b47e8fb18934f25">`onfocusin`<span offset-key="9205b6d7aea846ca9b47e8fb18934f25:1"> — When an element is about to get focus</span></span>

    <span key="255ae851e1c248a6ad8f14bea1627859">`onselect`<span offset-key="255ae851e1c248a6ad8f14bea1627859:1"> — The user selects some text (for </span>`<input>`<span offset-key="255ae851e1c248a6ad8f14bea1627859:3"> and </span>`<textarea>`<span offset-key="255ae851e1c248a6ad8f14bea1627859:5">)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="dab8965a6b234f8fa07ebc439b6f62cf">`onsubmit`<span offset-key="dab8965a6b234f8fa07ebc439b6f62cf:1"> — A form is submitted</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="40384a5f456b408a93062b4795b1459e">`ondrag`<span offset-key="40384a5f456b408a93062b4795b1459e:1"> — An element is dragged</span></span>

##

    <span key="38b911ffd1344a7b8d90cb6934c4dc19">`oncopy`<span offset-key="38b911ffd1344a7b8d90cb6934c4dc19:1"> — User copies the content of an element</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4446c41103ea4c2c81694725de6be487">`onabort`<span offset-key="4446c41103ea4c2c81694725de6be487:1"> — Media loading is aborted</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a8608f451ccc451aa55bf5c0caae27d0">`oncanplay`<span offset-key="a8608f451ccc451aa55bf5c0caae27d0:1"> — The browser can start playing media (e.g. a file has buffered enough)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="07fb3e5db9124d639d83b39b414b584c">`oncanplaythrough`<span offset-key="07fb3e5db9124d639d83b39b414b584c:1"> — The browser can play through media without stopping</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5a33c6df40954cffa398ad11de56efe2">`ondurationchange`<span offset-key="5a33c6df40954cffa398ad11de56efe2:1"> — The duration of the media changes</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a27544f1612848bda239e57d761bafdb">`onended`<span offset-key="a27544f1612848bda239e57d761bafdb:1"> — The media has reached its end</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f20237203efd4d88a124cbc84394dde6">`onloadeddata`<span offset-key="f20237203efd4d88a124cbc84394dde6:1"> — Media data is loaded</span></span>
